summary: Email correspondence between prosecutors and defense attorneys regarding the production of discovery materials in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, including the inadvertent production of unmarked confidential documents and arrangements for hard drive exchanges.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, coordinating receipt of discovery materials and hard drives from prosecutors.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, copied on emails regarding discovery production and hard drive logistics.

connections.description: Both are defense attorneys representing Ghislaine Maxwell, coordinating together on discovery matters.

events.title: Discovery Production Delivery
events.description: Prosecutors delivered discovery materials on a hard drive to defense counsel, with some documents inadvertently produced without 'Confidential' stamps.

events.title: Hard Drive Delivery
events.description: Defense delivered two 2TB hard drives to prosecutors for loading discovery materials, one for defense and one for the client at MDC.

keyFacts: Prosecutors inadvertently produced ten documents without 'Confidential' stamps, requiring defense to delete and replace them with corrected versions.
Discovery materials included unsealing materials pertaining to specific civil and miscellaneous case numbers (15 Civ. 7433, 19 Misc. 149, 17 Civ. 0616, 19 Misc. 179).
Hard drives were physically exchanged between prosecution and defense teams for loading and transferring discovery materials.
The correspondence shows active discovery production in August 2020 ahead of Ghislaine Maxwell's trial.
